description: One of five myo-o, or lords of light, whose threatening appearance guards the Law of Buddhism, Fudo Myo-o is equipped to guide the spiritual traveler past temptation on the path to enlightenment. This finely modeled figure of Fudo Myo-o, which means “the immovable or unshakable one,” reflects the highly detailed, realistic direction taken by Japanese sculptors in the Kamakura period (1185–1333).
title: Fudo Myo-o
